summary: This document is a timeline of payments exceeding $10,000 made by or on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein to various beneficiaries, including model agencies, property owners, legal firms, and trusts. It reveals financial support for alleged co-conspirators like Jean Luc Brunel and Ghislaine Maxwell, payments for Alan Dershowitz's legal expenses, and property transactions linked to Epstein's brother.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the financial timeline, making payments from his accounts to various beneficiaries including model agencies, property owners, and legal firms. He is accused of conspiring with Jean Luc Brunel.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Named as an alleged co-conspirator with Epstein in luring young European models to the U.S. His company, MC2 Model Management, received payments from Epstein.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's brother, who owns Ossa Properties, an affiliate of 301/66 Owners Corp., the entity that owns the property at 301 East 66th Street where models were allegedly housed.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: A recipient of payments from Epstein for legal expenses related to the lawsuit 'Doe v. United States of America'. Payments were made to his firm, Coffey Burlington, and his consulting LLC.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein allegedly paid for her legal expenses through his attorney, Darren Indyke, to the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., which represented her in a 2015 lawsuit.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's personal attorney who made payments on Epstein's behalf, including wire transfers to cover Ghislaine Maxwell's legal expenses.

persons.name: Jeffrey Bradley Edwards
persons.context: An attorney for several Epstein accusers who alleged in a civil lawsuit that Epstein had paid for the legal expenses of co-conspirators.

connections.description: Epstein and Brunel are accused of conspiring to lure young European models to the United States for illicit purposes. Epstein made payments to Brunel's company, MC2 Model Management.
Financial connection through property ownership; 301/66 Owners Corp. (payee) is an affiliate of Ossa Properties, a real estate company owned by Mark Epstein.
Epstein paid for Dershowitz's legal expenses in connection with the lawsuit 'Doe v. United States of America' via payments to Coffey Burlington and Alan Dershowitz Consulting LLC.
Epstein, through his attorney Darren Indyke, paid for Maxwell's legal expenses to the firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., which represented her in a 2015 lawsuit.
Indyke is Epstein's personal attorney who executed financial transactions on his behalf, including wire transfers for legal expenses of others.

events.title: Payment to MC Model Management
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein wires $25,000 to MC Model Management (linked to Jean Luc Brunel) from his TD Bank account.

events.title: Payment for Alan Dershowitz Legal Fees
events.description: Epstein wires $20,532 to Coffey Burlington, the law firm representing Alan Dershowitz, for legal expenses related to 'Doe v. United States of America'.

events.title: Purchase of Palm Beach Property
events.description: Epstein wires $1,235,900 to Horizon Title for the purchase of a property at 1132 San Michelle Way, allegedly for his property manager.

events.title: Payment for Ghislaine Maxwell's Legal Fees
events.description: Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, wires $21,379 to Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., the law firm representing Ghislaine Maxwell in a 2015 lawsuit.

events.title: Lawsuit Doe v. United States of America
events.description: A lawsuit filed by an Epstein accuser (case 9:08-cv-80736 in S.D. Fla.) in which Alan Dershowitz was involved, leading to Epstein's payments for Dershowitz's legal expenses.

events.title: Lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A lawsuit filed against Ghislaine Maxwell by an Epstein accuser (case 1:15-cv-07433 in S.D.N.Y.), for which Epstein paid her legal expenses.

locations: 1132 San Michelle Way, Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made substantial payments to MC2 Model Management, owned by alleged co-conspirator Jean Luc Brunel, who is accused of helping lure young European models for illicit purposes.

Epstein paid for the legal expenses of attorney Alan Dershowitz in connection with the lawsuit 'Doe v. United States of America', with payments made to the law firm Coffey Burlington and Alan Dershowitz Consulting LLC.
Epstein, through his attorney Darren Indyke, paid the legal fees of Ghislaine Maxwell to the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., for her defense in a 2015 lawsuit filed by an Epstein accuser.

The property at 301 East 66th Street in New York, where models were allegedly housed, is owned by 301/66 Owners Corp., an affiliate of Ossa Properties, a company owned by Epstein's brother, Mark Epstein.
Epstein used various bank accounts and entities (e.g., Jeffrey Epstein, Butterfly Trust, NES LLC, LSJE LLC, Southern Financial) to move funds, indicating a complex financial structure.
